text.p: U.S. credit ratings agency Moody's on Friday confirmed the Prime-1 short term ratings for Nokia Corporation and its guaranteed subsidiaries for commercial paper.

"The ratings are based on Nokia's leading position in the fast growing market for digital mobile telephone equipment and hand-sets, its technological edge in mobile data communications and its strong cash flow that, to date, has allowed (Nokia) to achieve a sound capital structure," Moody's said in a statement.

"Nokia's key challenges will be to keep production capacities in line with shifts in customer demand, to broaden its product range in this dynamic marketplace and, longer term, to defend its technological edge against larger competitors in a consolidating and technologically evolving industry," it said.

Moody's also said that it would become difficult for Nokia to avoid assisting its customers with financing because of competitive reasons, which will result in increasing use of Nokia's debt capacity.
